title: June 22
description:
First week of summer vacation!

Both kids were supposed to go to karate camp but Milo wasn't able to go because of his broken wrist. Instead, he hung out at home while Dean and Lucie took turn working from home. Thankfully, we managed to line up daily playdates with friends who were still in town and didn't have camp.

Things will get easier starting next week: Milo's upcoming camps are not as athletic and he has a real cast since Friday. It feels much sturdier and play-proof than his temporary splint.

children.title: Pathfinder
children.description: One day after camp, our dining room was taken over by a posse of boys, a handful of multi-sided dice and a big box of figurines. They stayed for dinner and had to be kicked out at bedtime.

children.title: Quest
children.description:
Felix had spend days preparing the quest for his friends. He is the undisputed dungeon master of his Pathfinder gang. He religiously pours over very thick rule books and masterminds the plot line.

This feels like it's teaching Felix good study habits. It's a lot of work! It requires a good deal of reading, planning, note taking, time management and leadership skills. We approve.

children.title: Red Cast
children.description:
After a week in the temporary splint, Milo finally got his cast on Friday. He is very happy to be able to bend his elbow again.

Big decision: what color to pick? He went for red. A good choice.

children.title: Red Ape
children.description: Lucie drew an orangutan. Did you know they are also known as "the red apes"? How appropriate.

children.title: Block
children.description: Now that he has his permanent cast, Milo is ready to go back to karate. Try to punch against that reinforced block!

children.title: Bath
children.description:
The new cast is easier to handle at bath time. About time! The boy was starting to stink.

Good news: Milo only has his cast for three weeks. That's a relief. It's coming off right before our planned road trip to Southern California and Nevada. The cast would have been a major drag on our extravagant hotel pools plans.

children.title: Bo Kata
children.description:
On Friday afternoon, the karate camp kids did a little demo to show off what they learned during the week. Lucie and Milo came straight to the dojo from the hospital.

This week at karate camp, kids learned to handle bos. A bo is a very long wooden stick.

children.title: Bo Fight
children.description: That's Felix crouching and grabbing the bottom of Alexander's bo.

children.title: Wolfeboro
children.description:
Early early Sunday morning, Lucie dropped off Felix and his camping gear. He left for Camp Wolfeboro with other scouts from his pack.

They are camping for a week in the Stanislaus National Forest, just north of Yosemite.

We trust Felix is going to have a blast. It's the sort of camp for which parents have to sign a "firearm permission slip". We hear they shoot actual rifles.

children.title: World Cup
children.description:
Lucie has been following the World Cup more than she usually would.

At Jut, the start-up where she is contracting, there are many soccer fans who watch the games together over lunch. She joined the fun and this has left her wanting for more

When France was scheduled to play at noon on a day she worked from home, she and Milo went to cheer for their homeland at our local biergarten. Olivier and Camille came as well. They were the perfect companions. They knew all the game stats and all the players on the French team. What a great game! France beat Switzerland 5-2. Allez les bleus!

children.title: USA
children.description:
On Sunday afternoon, we watched the game at home: USA vs. Portugal.

Our old friend Sylvie (who lives in Los Angeles) happened to be in town and she dropped by. Too bad for her, she missed the morning's game in which her home country (Belgium) won.

Dean and Sylvie celebrate the second goal from the US team which gave them a lead over Portugal.

heartbreakingly, in the last few seconds of the game, Portugal managed to tie, 2-2.
